reviews.review_msg: Genuinely speaking, Bingham is a one of a kind academic inspiration unlike any other that I have ever witnessed in undergrad. Lecture concepts share a common philosophical thread that all tie into the course themes in which he explains and reiterates thoroughly throughout the semester. Workload was quite easy and the marking was reasonable.

Lectures are really engaging and the course concepts are really interesting. Weekly readings and logs and a project for grading, but very do-able and you have a lot of freedom to write about what you want as long as you refer to readings and lecture. Funny guy but rambles a lot. Lecture is mandatory as you have to input attendance to get a grade.

Charles is the most wholesome professor. He is so kind hearted and truly cares about his students. He is the best professor I have had at SFU and he makes me feel like this is how school and teachers should all be like. Caring of your mental health, understanding, and patient. He understands that we are just human and we make mistakes.
